derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French medler, from medle 'medlar fruit', from Latin mespila, from Greek mespilē, mespilon

means.word_mean: 1. small deciduous tree of southern Africa having edible fruit
2. small deciduous Eurasian tree cultivated for its fruit that resemble crab apples
3. South African globular fruit with brown leathery skin and sweet-acid pithy flesh
